title: East German Typography
content:
Hiya, you might have seen this post in other type forums, so apologies beforehand.   
   
I am trying to search for more information regarding East German typography and typographers. Specifically:   
   
1. Albert Kapr   
He was a type designer and typographer who was the Art Director of TypoArt (the centralized press owned by the East German goverment). I'm trying to find out what his contribution towards the development of East German typography was and if anyone has samples of his work.   
   
2. Influencial typographers   
Does anyone know of any influential type designers from East Germany?   
   
3. VEB Typoart Dresden   
I know that it became the centralized press for the East German govenment. It was an almalgamation of a few foundries, specifically Schelter and Giesecke of Liepzig. I am particularly interested in its output and developement during the GDR years.   
   
Any pointers...?   
   
Joyce
author: joyce

Getting back to the original subject. I used to know Albert Kapr. He was a fine type and book designer, calligrapher and typographer. But his greatest accomplishment, in my opinion, was that he managed to preserve and develop the fine art of type and book design in the Communist Germany. In fact, he was a devout Communist himself, and he managed to convince his fellow Parteigenossen, in both Leipzig and Berlin, that the quality of book design and printing is important for the image (and the economy!) of the Deutsche Demokratische Republik.
